div.p: A Short and Plain CATECHISM Inſtructing a Learner OF CHRISTIAN RELIGION, what he is to believe, and what to Practiſe.
The Fourth Edition.
London, Printed, for Francis Tyton, at the three Daggers near the Inner-Temple Gate in Fleetſtreet. 1668.

div.head: A Short CATECHISM.

p.label: Queſt.
p.hi: WHAT is man?

div.p: Anſw. A reaſonable creature.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What mean you when you ſay you are reaſonable?

div.p: A. I mean I am above a beaſt, and have ſomething within me whereby I know what I do, and why.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: That I may ſee how your knowledge leads to practice: tell me, what learn you from your being reaſonable?

div.p: A. That I never do any thing of which I cannot give a good account to my ſelf and others.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: You ſaid you was a creature, what mean you by that?

div.p: A. I mean, I once was not, but was made, and am preſerved by another.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What learn you hence?

div.p: A. That I muſt conſtantly live in dependance on him that made me.
Q. Who made you?

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is God?

div.p: A. God is a Being whollyIohn 4.24. ſpiritual, and therein above my ſelf, moſtPſal. 103.8. gracious,1 Pet. 1.5, 16. holy,Rom. 16.27. Rom. 11.33. wiſe,Iob 40.9, &c. powerful, infinite in all perfections, and therein above all ſpirits.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: You ſay God is a Being wholly ſpiritual, what mean you by it?

div.p: A. I mean he is a Being that hath no fleſh and bones as I have,Ier. 32.18, 19. Iob. 11.7. and cannot be perceived by any of my ſenſes, nor can I make any thing like him.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: You have acknowledged a God, and told me he is a Spirit, what learn you hence?

div.p: A. That I am bound to worſhip him,Ioh. 4.23, 24. and to worſhip him in ſpirit.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: You ſaid he was gracious, what mean you by his grace?

div.p: A. I mean his readineſs to do all good.Exod. 34.6, 7. Pſal. 119.68.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What learn you hence?

div.p: A. To expect from his bounty whatſoever he ſeeth needful for me.Pſal. 13.5, 6. Pſal. 39.7.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: You ſaid God was holy, what mean you by it?

div.p: A. That he neither can or will do any evil,Pſal. 11.7. Exod. 20.5. Hab. 1.13. and can neither love nor approve it in any other.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What learn you hence?

div.p: A. Never to imagine his grace will countenance me in ſin.Exod. 34.6, 7.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: You ſaid God was wiſe, what mean you by it?

div.p: A. That he hathJer. 32.19. Prov. 15.3. knowledge of all things, andProv. 8.14, 15, 16. ability to do all things according to it.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What learn you hence?

div.p: A. To do allHeb. 4.13. as in his ſight, and begging direction of him to reſtPſal. 37.5, 6, 7. ſatisfied in his diſpoſal.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: You ſaid God was powerful, what mean you by it?

div.p: A. That he isGen. 5.11. almighty, and can do all things, thatJob 34.12. Tit 1.2. agree with his wiſdom and holineſs.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What learn you hence?

div.p:
A. To fear himMat. 10.28. above all creatures, being2 King. 7.1, 2. confident, that what he
hath promiſed or threatned,Eph. 3.20. ſhall be fulfilled, though it ſeem impoſſible to fleſh and blood.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: You added God was infinite in all perfections, what doth that teach you?

div.p: A. Never to admit any low or unworthy thoughts of God;Job 26.14. Rom. 11.33. and when I have the higheſt, then to remember I know him beſt, when I admire him moſt.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: You have told me you was made, and that God was your maker, for what end did he make you?

div.p: A. That byEccl. 12.13. faithful ſervice to him, I mightMat. 5.8. be happy in the enjoyment of him.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What learn you hence?

div.p:
A. Carefully to perform my duty to God,Pſal. 62.5, •
▪ 8, 9, 10. and never to ſeek happineſs in worldly pleaſures, and profits, or any thing below him.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: You were made to ſerve God, how will he be ſerved?

div.p: A. According to his will revealed in the Scriptures,2 Tim. 3.15, 16, 17. wherein all things are contained, which I am to believe and practiſe.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What learn you hence?

div.p: A. Diligently to read & ſearch them.1 Tim. 4.13 Joh. 5.39.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What doth the Scripture teach you concerning man, which you have not yet told me?

div.p: A. The Scriptures give the Hiſtory of the creation of the world out of nothing, and of Adam the firſt man.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: How was Adam the firſt man created?

div.p: A. The Scripture ſaith, God made him in his ownGen. 1.26. Gen. 5.1. Image, that he wasEccl. 7.27. upright, and ſet as LordGen. 1.26. over his Works.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What learn you hence?

div.p: A. To admire Gods goodneſs in making the world and man in it, in ſuch an excellent eſtate,Pſal. 104. The whole Pſalm. Pſal. 8.3, 4, 5, 6. ſince nothing made by him, could bring any profit to him.
Q. Did Adam alwayes continue in the ſtate God made him?
A. No: he diſobeyed Gods command in eating forbidden fruit,Gen. 3. and ſo fell from it.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What learn you hence?

div.p: A. Never to charge God with mans ſin,Jam. 1.13, 14. but condemn him whoſe behaviour was unworthy to God, and cruel to himſelf.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What was the ſtate into which he fell?

div.p: A. A ſtate of ſin and miſery.Gen. 3. Rom. 5.12. Jam. 1.14, 15.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the ſtate in which you are?

div.p: A. Mine, and every mans is the ſame, for we all find in our ſelves luſt conceiving and bringing forth ſin, and ſin finiſhed, bringeth forth death.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What learn you hence?

div.p: A. To bewail my ſad and lamentable condition from which I am not able to deliver my ſelf.Rom. 7.24.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: O wretched creature that thou art, Who can or will deliver thee?

div.p: A. I thank God through Jeſus Chriſt whom he hath provided to be a Saviour.Rom. 7.25.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: Who is this Jeſus Chriſt the Saviour?

div.p: A. God and man,Joh. 1.14. 1 Tim. 3.16. or God manifeſted in the fleſh.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What learn you hence?

div.p: A. To be much incouraged,Heb. 2.16, 17, 18. Heb. 4.14, 15, 16. notwithſtanding my ſad condition, ſince my Saviour being both God and man is able and willing to help me.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What did Chriſt do for you.

div.p:
A. He lived a holyHeb. 4.15. yet an afflicted
life, and1 Pet. 3.18. dyed for our ſins upon the Croſs,Mat. 28.6. Rom. 4.15. roſe out of the grave,Act. 1.9. Eph. 4.8. aſcended into heaven, where he now ſits to make interceſſion.Heb. 7.25.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What learn you hence?

div.p: A. 2 Cor. 5. 14, 15. Cheerfully to obey him, and willingly to part with every thing for him, who parted with life for me, and is ſtill mindfull of me.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What good do you hope for from this Saviour?

div.p: A. ARom. 8.32. Phil. 4.19. ſupply of all my wants; eſpeciallyAct. 5.31. Tit. 3.5, 6. forgiveneſs of my ſins,Tit. 3.7. ſanctification, and everlaſtingHeb. 5.9. ſalvation.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What learn you hence?

div.p: A. In no caſe to entertain any deſpairing thoughts.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: How muſt you addreſs your ſelf to God, for the obtaining the mercies you hope for by Chriſt?

div.p:
A. Jam. 4.8, 9, 10. Iſa. 1.15, 16, 17, 18. Act. 8.22. Firſt, with a deep ſenſe of my unworthineſs, unfeignedly repenting that ever I ſinned againſt him,Heb. 10.20, 21, 22. (2) With a real ſenſe of his undeſerved goodneſs, humbly by faith in Chriſt expecting from his free grace.Iſa. 55.6, 7. Act. 9.6. (3) Heartily reſolving to walk before
him in newneſs of life all my dayes.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: By your anſwer, you may perceive an abſolute neceſſity of repentance, faith, and newneſs of life; firſt, what is repentance?

div.p: A. Such a ſorrow for ſin, that works hatred and forſaking of it.2 Cor. 7.10, 11. Heb. 6.1.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is faith in Chriſt?

div.p: A. A hearty perſwaſion that he is theJoh. 6.69. Chap. 11.27. Saviour, thatMark. 1.15. Acts 15.7. what he hath ſaid, and what is ſaid of him in the Goſpel, is true; ſo as toHeb. 11.8. obey his commands,v. 7. fear his threatnings,v. 13. Rom. 4.18, 19, 20, 21. truſt him for the performances of all his promiſes.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is newneſs of life?

div.p: A. It conſiſts in denying ungodlineſs, and worldly luſts, and living ſoberly, righteouſly and godlily.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: When may you be ſaid to live ſoberly?

div.p: A. When in all things I live temperately and chaſtly,Rom. 13.13. 1 Theſ. 5.7, 8. Tit. 3.2. moderating all unruly paſſion.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: When may you be ſaid to live righteouſly?

div.p: A. When in all my dealings I do as I would be done by.Mat. 7.12.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: When may you be ſaid to live godlily?

div.p: A. When in my whole converſation I behave my ſelf towards God, as myPſal. 100.1, 2. Creator and my1 Cor. 6.20. 1 Pet. 1.17, 18. Redeemer.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: I hope you intend to practiſe all this, but are you able of your ſelf?

div.p: A. No, I am not of my ſelf ſufficient, ſo much as to think one good thought.2 Cor. 3.5.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What muſt enable you?

div.p: A. Gods bleſſed Spirit which he hath promiſed.Luk. 11.13. Eph. 3.16.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: You ſay the ſpirit muſt enable you, are you then idly to lye ſtill and do nothing?

div.p: A. No,Phil. 2.12, 13. I am therefore to work out my ſalvation with fear and trembling, becauſe God works in me to will and to do of his good pleaſure.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: If you muſt not be idle what means muſt you uſe?

div.p: A. 1 Tim. 4.13.15, 16. Rom. 10.17. Firſt, reading, hearing, meditating of the Word (which is the power of God to ſalvation)Luk. 11.13. (2) PrayerPſal. 119.59. Act. 16.25, &c. (3) ſerious conſideration of my actions, and of all Gods providences to my ſelf and othersMat. 16.16. 1 Cor. 11.24, 25. (4) Uſe of the ſacraments, Baptiſm, and the Lords Supper.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: I leſs ſuſpect your knowledge in the reſt, what is Baptiſm?

div.p: A. Waſhing with water in the Name of the Father,Mat. 28.19. Son, and Holy Ghoſt.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: Of what uſe may your Baptiſm be to you, ſince you was Baptiſed in your infancy?

div.p: A. The conſideration of it provokes to newneſs of life,Act. 22.16. Rom. 6.4. (1) Becauſe outward waſhing ſignifies purity.1 Cor. 1.13, 15. 1 Cor. 10.2. (2) Becauſe my being baptized in Chriſts Name, engages me to own his Doctrine, and keep his Laws, Gal. 3.27.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the Lords Supper?

div.p: A. It's according to Chriſts inſtitution, bread broken and eaten, wine. powred forth and drunk,Mat. 26.26, 27, 28. 1 Cor. 11.24, 25. in remembrance of Chriſt, whoſe body was broken for us, and blood ſhed for the remiſſion of ſin.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: How is this uſefull to provoke you to newneſs of life?

div.p: A. While the evil of ſin, and the love of Chriſt crucified is herein ſet before my eyes, I am conſtrained to live to him who dyed for me.

p.label: Q.
p.hi:
I pray God whenſoever you receive
this Sacrament, you may. But do all receive this benefit?

div.p: A. No,1 Cor. 11.21, &c. they cannot who underſtand not the ends of Chriſts death, nor they who deſire not to enjoy them.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What if you neglect theſe means and quench the ſpirit?

div.p: A. I ſhew that I undervalue all that Chriſt hath done and ſuffered,John 3.18, 19. Heb. 2.3. Chap. 10.29. Chap. 12.25. and provoke God to bring on me a greater meaſure of his wrath, for this my contempt, than if I had never heard of a Saviour.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: Do you believe God will bring this wrath on you, if you thus behave your ſelf?

div.p: A. Yes,Acts 17.31. 2 Cor. 5.10. I believe God hath appointed a day wherein he will judge the world in righteouſneſs, and render to every man according to what he hath done in the fleſh, whether it be good or bad.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What ſhall be the condition of all men after the day of Judgement?

div.p:
A. To them who by patient continuance in well-doing,Rom. 2.7, 8, 9. Mat. 25.31. &c. ſeek for glory God will give eternal life, but to them that obey not the truth, and live in
unrighteouſneſs, tribulation, and anguiſh, indignation and wrath, the portion of every ſoul that doth evil.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: Seeing we profeſs to believe theſe things, what manner of perſons ought we to be?

div.p: A. We ought to live in all holy converſation and godlineſs,2 Pet. 3.11, 14.18. being diligent that we may be found of God in peace, without ſpot, and blameleſs; growing in grace, and in the knowledge of our Lord and Saviour Jeſus Ghriſt: to whom be glory both now and for ever. Amen.

div.head: THE CREED.
div.p: I Believe in God the Father Almighty, Maker of Heaven and Earth. And in Jeſus Chriſt his only Son our Lord, which was conceived by the Holy Ghoſt, born of the Virgin Mary, ſuffered under Pontius Pilate, was crucified dead and buried, he deſcended into Hell. The third day he aroſe from the dead. He aſcended into Heaven, and ſitteth on at the right hand of God the Father Almighty: From thence he ſhall come to judge the quick and the dead. I believe in the Holy Ghoſt, the Holy Catholick Church, the Communion of Saints, the forgiveneſs of ſins, the reſurrection of the body, and the life everlaſting. Amen.

div.head: The LORDS PRAYER.
div.p: OUR Father which art in Heaven, Hallowed be thy Name, Thy Kingdom come, Thy will be done on Earth as it is in Heaven, Give us this day our daily bread, And forgive us our debts, as we forgive our debtors, And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil: for thine is the Kingdom, and the power, and the glory for ever. Amen.

div.head: The X. COMMANDMENTS.
div.p: GOD ſpake all theſe words, ſaying, I am the LORD thy God, which hath brought thee out of the land of Egypt, out of the houſe of bondage.

list.item: 1 Thou ſhalt have no other gods before me.

2 Thou ſhalt not make unto thee any graven image, or any likeneſs of any thing, that is in heaven above, or that is in the earth beneath, or that is in the water under the earth: thou ſhalt not bow down thy ſelf to them, nor ſerve them: For I the LORD thy God am a Iealous God, viſiting the iniquity of the Fathers upon the children, unto the third and fourth generation of them that hate me: and ſhewing mercy unto thouſands of them that love me and keep my Commandments.
3 Thou ſhalt not take the name of the LORD thy God in vain: for the LORD will not hold him guiltleſs, that taketh his name in vain.

4 Remember the Sabbath day to kéep it holy: Six days ſhalt thou labour, and do all thy work, but the ſeventh day is the Sabbath of the LORD thy God, in it thou ſhalt not do any work, thou, nor thy ſon, nor thy daughter, thy man-ſervant, nor thy maid-ſervant, nor thy Cattel, nor thy ſtranger that is within thy gates: For in ſix days the Lord made heaven and earth, the ſea, and all that in them is, and reſted the ſeventh day: wherefore the LORD bleſſed the Sabbath day and hallowed it.
5 Honour thy father and thy mother: that thy days may be long upon the land which the LORD thy God giveth thée.
9 Thou ſhalt not bear falſe witneſs againſt thy neighbour.
10 Thou ſhalt not cover thy neighbours houſe, thou ſhalt not cover thy neighbours wiſe, nor his man-ſervant, nor his maid-ſervant, nor his oxe, nor his aſs, nor any thing that is thy neighbours.
